result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A. Whitley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other probation cases

miscConds.notes:
*Pay Costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Continue with sobriety by complying with all treatment rehabilitation that he is currently engaged in.
*Early discharge if recommended by the agent and can be discharged simultaneously with current probation as determined by the agent
*Apply cash bond to fine/costs

records.addlTxt: Order Permitting Defense Counsel to Withdraw filed by Atty Gregg Waterman

Defendant Joshua A Whitley in court with Attorney (Atty) Gregg Earl Waterman. Defendant Joshua A Whitley in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 12CF468 and 15CF309.

1:48 p.m.  Case is called by the Court and appearances are stated by Atty Zell.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the Revocation packet(s) and Warrant.
Atty Zell has received the packet and has no changes, corrections or updates.
The State has complied with victim notification; victim does not appear in Court today and no victim impact statement was provided.
Atty Waterman has received his packet and states his corrections on the record.
1:53 p.m.  Assistant DA argues regarding sentencing.
1:57 p.m.  Attorney for the defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Atty Waterman provides the Court with certificates of completion to review; certificates will be provided back to the defendant.
2:03 p.m.  Defendant makes statements prior to his sentencing.
2:06 p.m.  Court makes statements to the defendant and questions him with regards to what happened and brought him back to Court today.

BY THE COURT:
12CF468:
Count 1 -

Count 2 -
1 year in county jail 
326 days of incarceration credit
Judgment already created for the costs/surcharges

Count 3 -
Count 4 -

15CF309:
Count 1 -
1 year in county jail - concurrent with 12CF468
326 days of incarceration credit

records.addlTxt: Correspondence from Barron County in re:  Request to Change Placement/Revise Dispositional Order

Defendant Joshua A. Whitley in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:44 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Record review has not been received by any party.
Ms Jill Hytry from probation & parole is in the courtroom today and makes statements.
Ms Jill Hytry does not have her file of the defendant with her.
Court questions the parties if they are willing to go through with the sentencing even though a record review was not completed.  No objection by Atty Knaapen.
Bailiff to get the file.
9:49 a.m.  Ms Jill Hytry is sworn in.
Atty Sheets indicates that he had supoenaed Jill Hytry to be in the courtroom today.
Direct examination by Atty Sheets.
9:57 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Knaapen.
9:59 a.m.  Court questions Jill Hytry.
10:03 a.m.  Atty Knaapen provides the Court with some of the information being requested.
Court continues to question Jill Hytry.
Atty Sheets makes additional statements and provides the Court with a document from Barron County.
Court reviews the document from Barron County.
10:12 a.m.  Jill Hytry is excused.
Court makes statements on the document received from Barron County.

Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Withhold sentence
Placed on probation of 18 months - concurrent with any other probation cases
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Continue with sobriety by complying with all treatement rehabilitation that he is currently engaged in.
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Early discharge if recommended by the agent and can be discharged simultaneously with current probation as determined by the agent.  
Apply cash bond to the fine/costs

20 days to appeal
